children.name: local time
children.definition: noun giờ địa phươnghệ thống thời gian đangđược dùng trong một vùng cụ thể trên thế giới;
examples: the official time in a country or an area

children.name: time
examples: [ U ] the system of recording hours used in different parts of the world
_Greenwich Mean Time
_daylight saving time

children.name: standard time
examples: In a country or a part of a country, standard time is the time which is officially used.

children.name: darkness
children.definition: /ˈdɑːʳknɪs, ˈdɑːʳknəs/  aplaceortimewhere there is no light:
examples: ban đêm/ bóng tối, chỗ tối
▪ A voice came from out of the darkness, but she couldn’t see anyone.
Một giọng nói vọng ra từ bóng tối, nhưng cô ấy không thể thấy được gì
▪ As my eyes became used to the darkness I could make out a bed in the corner of the room.
Khi mắt tôi trở nên tối đi, tôi có thể nhận ra cái giường ở trong góc phòng
▪ The city was a violent place at that time, and it was not safe to walk the streets during the hours of darkness.
Thành phố này hiện giờ là một nơi bạo động, và đi bộ vào ban đêm không an toàn tí nào
in complete darkness
hoàn toàn trong bóng tối
▪ Colour films must be developed in complete darkness.
Phim màu phải được làm ở trong bóng tối hoàn toàn
darknessnoun[ U ]bóng tối
_The city centre wasplunged intodarkness by the power cut.
pitch darknessnoun[ U ] (alsopitch blackness)
_Suddenly the lights went out, and the house was leftinpitch darkness.

children.name: before/after dark
children.definition: before/after the sun has gone down
examples: _It isn't safe to leave the house after dark.
_I want to be home before dark.

children.name: overnight
examples: for or during the night
_an overnight stop inParis
_You can stay overnight if you want to.
_Don't forget to pack an overnightbag(= a bag for things that you need when you stay away from home for a night) .

children.name: at night, especially every night
examples: _Because she's a nurse she often has toworknights.
_USI like to go out nights and sleep during the day.

children.name: at night
examples: _It gets coldatnight.

children.name: on one evening recently
examples: _I saw Naomi at the club the other night.

children.name: ( buoi toi no toi da nhin thay Naomi tai cau lac bo )
tonight
examples: đêm nay, tối nay/vào đêm nay, vào tối nay
(during) the night of the present day
_Tonight will be my first opportunity to meet her.
_Tonight's meeting will take place in the main school hall.

children.name: afternoon
examples: the period which starts at abouttwelveo'clock or after the meal in the middle of the day and ends at aboutsixo'clock or when thesungoes down
_It was a sunny afternoon.
_She works three afternoons a week at the library.
_It was on a Saturday afternoon.
_My baby usually sleepsin theafternoons.
_Let's go to the parkthisafternoon.
_I spoke to heryesterdayafternoon.
_I'll meet youtomorrowafternoon at about 3.30.
_She's coming roundonWednesday afternoon.
_He's been in a bad moodallafternoon.
_She likes to have an afternoon nap.
_We got an early-/mid-/late-afternoon flight.
afternoonsadverbUS chiều chiều
every afternoon or on many afternoons
_He works afternoons.

children.name: evening
children.definition: nounchiều tối ( lúc ánh sáng ban ngày giảm đi,6 giờ, thường là lúc mọi người nghỉ việc, tan học )
examples: the part of the day between the end of the afternoon and night
_a chilly evening
_I work in a restaurant and only get one eveningoffa week.
_Thank you for such a lovely evening.
_I always go to see a filmonFriday evenings.
_In theevenings, I like to relax.
_I'm working latethisevening.
_What are you doingtomorrowevening?
_It poured downallevening and most of the night as well.
_What time do you usually get homein theevening?
eveningsadverbmainly US vào mỗi buổi tối
in the evening
_What time do you get home evenings?
_I work evenings.

children.name: morning
examples: the part of the day from the time when the sun rises or you wake up until the middle of the day orlunchtime
_a beautiful/sunny/wet morning
_I work three mornings a week at the bookshop.
_She only worksin themornings.
_What's our schedule forthismorning?
_I'd like an appointment fortomorrowmorning, please.
_I'll see youonSaturday morning.
_I had too much to drink at Sarah's party, and I felt terriblethemorningafter.
morningsadverbmainly US mỗi buổi sáng
every morning
_Mornings we go running in the park.
in the morning
during the early part of the day
_I listen to the radio in the morning.
in the morning
at some time between twelve o'clock at night
and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day
_The murder took placeatfour in the morning.

children.name: night
children.definition: nounEVENING buổi tối ( từ lúc mặt trời đã lặn đên lúc đi ngủ )

children.name: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, oraboutthat time
examples: _We used to ski before noon then take a long lunch.
_By noon, we had had ten phone calls.

children.name: hour
children.definition: noun giờ ( lượng thời gian hoạt động gì diễn ra )

children.name: day
children.definition: nounngày ( lượng thời gian làm việc học hành )
examples: the time that you usually spend at work or at school
_a normal working day
_I work a seven-hour day.
_We're having to work a six-day week to cope with demand.
_She's at home today-she's having a dayoff.

children.name: lights-out
children.definition: noun giờ tắt đèn đi ngủ

children.name: (at a school where children live or in the army) the time in the evening when the lightsare switched off in the room where people sleep
examples: _No talking after lights-out!

children.name: midnight
children.definition: nounđúngnửa đêm, mười hai giờ đêm

children.name: 12 o'clock in the middle of the night
examples: _There's a great film on TVatmidnight.
_It was after midnight when we got home.

children.name: nightfall
examples: the time in the evening when it becomes dark

children.name: day
examples: used to refer to the period in 24 hours when it is naturally light
_a bright, sunny day
_It's rainedallday today.
_These animals sleep in the day and hunt at night.

children.name: (the period when there is) natural light from the sun
examples: _The colours look much better in daylight.

children.name: daytime
examples: the period between the time when the sun rises and the time it goes down, or the part of the day which is neither evening nor night
_I tend to sleepin/duringthe daytime and study at night.
_a regular daytime job
_a daytime telephone number
_daytime television

children.name: the time in every 24-hour period when it is dark
examples: _It's pretty noisy at night-time.

children.name: the time at which you usually getinto your bed in order to sleep
examples: _Put your toys away now, it's bedtime.
_Eleven o'clock ispast mybedtime.
_I like to have a hot drinkatbedtime.
_He reads his children a bedtimestoryevery night.

children.name: lunch hour
examples: the period in the middle of the day when people stop work to have lunch

children.name: the time in the middle of the day when most people eat a meal
examples: _What are you doingatlunchtime?

children.name: a time at which a meal is eaten
examples: _The only time our family gets together isatmealtimes.

children.name: the time at which the main meal of the day is eaten
examples: _I didn't get home till after dinnertime.

children.name: tea break
children.definition: noun UK giờ giải lao; giờ nghỉ giải lao

children.name: a short rest from working, usually spent drinking tea or something similar
examples: _We had a chat in our tea break.

children.name: teatime
children.definition: noun giờ nghỉ uống trà ăn nhẹ
examples: the time in the afternoon when some people eat a small meal

children.name: when it is naturally light
examples: _I prefer travelling by day.

children.name: by night
children.definition: : vào buổi tối ( đến lúc ngủ )
examples: _She's a singer in a barbynight and a secretary by day.

children.name: sunrise
examples: [ U ] (US informal alsosun-up) the time in the morning when the sun starts to rise in the sky
_They went outatsunrise to go bird-watching.
_We have to leave before sun-up tomorrow.
sunrisenoun
[ C ] the appearance of the sky when the sun starts to rise
_There was a beautiful sunrise this morning.

children.name: sunset
examples: [ U ] the time in the evening when you last see the sun in the sky
_The fishermen set outat sunsetfor a night's fishing.
sunsetnoun
[ C ] the appearance of the sky in the evening before the sun goes down
_We sat on the beach watching a spectacular sunset.
sunset/ˈsʌnset/ [countable/uncountable noun] the time when the sun goes down or the way the sun looks when it goes down:
mặt trời lặn
▪ We sat and watched the glorious sunset from across the Mekong river.
at sunset
at the time when the sun is setting
▪ You may prefer to sit on the terrace sipping a cocktail at sunset.

children.name: the time in the evening when you last see the sun in the sky
examples: _We left early, anxious to make it back toFlorencebefore/bysundown.

children.name: small hours
children.definition: smallhoursplural nounnhững giờ rất sớm của buổi sáng ( 3, 4, 5 giờ sáng..)

children.name: the early hours of the morning, between twelve o'clock at night and the time when thesun rises
examples: _She was up untilthesmall hours of the morning trying to finish her essay.

children.name: the time when the sun first appears in the morning
examples: _We'll leaveatfirst light.

children.name: daybreak
children.definition: noun lúc tảng sáng; lúc rạng đông; lúc bình minh
examples: dawn (EARLY MORNING)

children.name: dawn
children.definition: noun bình minh; rạng đông; lúc sáng tinh mơ

children.name: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky
examples: _We wokeatdawn.
_We left as dawn wasbreaking(= starting) .
_We left at thebreak ofdawn.

_Twenty-three people were arrested and large quantities of heroin were seized in a dawnraid(= when police officers suddenly enter a building, in an attempt to catch people involved in illegal activities) .

children.name: dusk
children.definition: noun hoàng hôn; lúc chạng vạng; lúc tối nhá nhem

children.name: the time before night when it is not yet dark
examples: _As duskfell, bats began to fly between the trees.

children.name: from dawn to dusk
examples: _We worked from dawn to dusk, seven days a week.

children.name: high noon
examples: exactlytwelve o'clock, when the sun should be at its highest point in the sky

children.name: 12 o'clock in the middle of the day
examples: _I just have a sandwichatmidday/for my midday meal.

children.name: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, or about that time
examples: _We used to ski before noon then take a long lunch.
_By noon, we had had ten phone calls.
